episode_summary: This episode, recorded at the Cheltenham Literature Festival, features facts about unusual uses of the phrase 'Make America Great Again', a marathon runner beaten by costumed competitors, the Queen's nickname, and a police strategy to lower crime rates by discouraging crime reporting.

facts.fact: This year the phrase "Make America Great Again" adorned half a million hats and one anus.
EastEnders star Adam Woodyatt was beaten in the London marathon this year by a man in a sleeping bag, a woman in a full-body dinosaur suit, and a man carrying a tumble dryer.
Queensland, Australian police successfully lowered crime rates this year by asking victims to stop reporting crimes.
